chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas C. Quaderer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas Charles Quaderer in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Defendant Thomas Charles Quaderer in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 16 CF 18 SEHR.  State recites agreement - 16 CF 18 - 1 year county jail credit good time and time served 126 days  - costs and court obligations to be converted to civil judgment if unpaid     16 CF 256: count 1 - Prison 18 months 18 months ES - imposed/stayed - 3 years probation - costs - eligible for challenge and earned release.  DE entered plea of NC to count 1 16 CF 256.      DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Both atty's argue sentence.  DE addressed the Court

COURT:  16 CF 256:  Prison 3 years - 18 months incarceration and 18 months ES imposed/stayed  - Probation 3 years following sentence in 16 CF 18 - costs - AODA to be done within the first 60 days of being on probation - any counseling DOC may impose -  and count 2 is dismissed and read-in -    
if revoked DE is eligible for challenge and earned release.


16 CF 18:  1 year county jail with good time, huber and time served of 126 days time served - court obligations as previously ordered are converted to civil judgment
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 16, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Thomas C. Quaderer in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  DE entered plea of guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.  

Court:  Sentence w/held probation 3 years - fine/costs $906.00 - AODA and any follow thru - absolute sobriety/no alcohol/drug use without valid Rx - DNA sample and surcharge - any conditions DOC may impose

Defendant Thomas C. Quaderer in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does not wish to have preliminary exam.  Court finds DE has freely waived prelim.  Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a prelim.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Atty Larimore acknowledges receipt of information - waived reading entered plea of ng.

Defendant Thomas C. Quaderer in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OFF THE RECORD.  Reset.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Thomas C. Quaderer in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Thomas C. Quaderer in custody appeared by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   DEF waives time limits on the preliminary hearing.   Bond Continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant appeared in custody via video.  State appeared by Atty Poquette.  Probable Cause found and bail set at $1000.00 signature bond with Absolute sobriety.
